item.description:
Let's try something a little bit different -- a late-day hike to the summit of Mount Major in Alton, NH.  The views of Lake Winnipesaukee and the surrounding area are breathtaking.

We'll be hiking via the Boulder Loop Trail which is about 1.6 miles.  The hike to the summit should take us 1 1/12 hours or so.  We'll stop for a snack at the top--be sure to bring water and some goodies!  We can decide then which trail to take back to the parking lot.  Bring a jacket/fleece even if it's a warm day--it could be cooler and breezy on the open and rocky top of the mountain.

Please be sure to wear good hiking shoes/boots as we will be hiking on gravel, boulders, and across some ledge.

It could be getting dusky as we hike down, so it's probably a good idea to bring a flashlight or a headlamp.  And don't forget your camera ! ! !

This is a combined event--we will also be joined by members of Social Fun and Trailblazers.

 

If there is interest, we'll be stopping for dinner after the hike--Shibley's at the Pier sounds good, Pops Clam Shack is also a possibility.

 

DIRECTIONS:

The parking lot and trailheads for Mount Major are located in Alton, New Hampshire on Route 11, 4.2 miles north of Alton Bay.  Heading north, the parking lot turn-off is located shortly after a scenic vista and is on the left-hand side of the road.

A little bit about Mount Major:  Mount Major is a mountain loacated in Alton, New Hampshire, south of Lake Winnepesaukee and northeast of Straightback Mountain of the Belknap Rnage.  The scenic, rocky summit is a popular hiking destination, accessible by multiple trails including the Maount Major Trail, the Brook Trail, and the Boulder Loop.
item.name: Mount Major--a late day hike
